title: Astronomy
description: Planets, stars, galaxies, and basic space concepts.

questions.prompt: What is the name of the galaxy that contains our Solar System?
questions.explanation: Our Solar System is inside the Milky Way galaxy.

questions.prompt: What is the closest star to Earth?
questions.explanation: The Sun is Earth's nearest star; Proxima Centauri is the nearest star beyond the Sun.

questions.prompt: Which planet is often called the “Red Planet”?
questions.explanation: Mars appears reddish largely because iron-rich dust and rocks are oxidized (rusted).
questions.sourceLabel: NASA Space Place: All About Mars

questions.prompt: What is the largest planet in our Solar System?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the largest planet by diameter and mass.
questions.sourceLabel: NASA Science: Planet Sizes and Locations

questions.prompt: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the innermost planet and has the shortest orbital period.
questions.sourceLabel: NASA Science: Orbits and Kepler's Laws

questions.prompt: A light-year is a unit of…
questions.explanation: A light-year is the distance light travels in vacuum in one year.

questions.prompt: Where is the main asteroid belt located?
questions.explanation: The main asteroid belt orbits the Sun between Mars and Jupiter.

questions.prompt: What do we call the streak of light when a small space rock burns in Earth’s atmosphere?
questions.explanation: A meteor is the visible streak of light produced when a meteoroid heats up in Earth's atmosphere.

questions.prompt: A “year” on Earth is mainly defined by…
questions.explanation: A year is based on Earth's orbital period around the Sun (about 365 days plus ~6 hours).
questions.sourceLabel: NASA Space Place: What Is a Leap Year?

questions.prompt: Which planet is famous for its large, bright ring system?
questions.explanation: Saturn's rings are made mostly of ice particles and rocky debris.

image.alt: Saturn with its rings, photographed during equinox

questions.prompt: The Kuiper Belt is located…
questions.explanation: The Kuiper Belt is a region beyond Neptune containing many icy bodies (including dwarf planets).

questions.prompt: Compared to Earth, Venus’s surface pressure is…
questions.explanation: Venus has a very dense CO₂ atmosphere; surface pressure is about 92 times Earth's.

questions.prompt: Moon phases are mainly caused by…
choices: The Moon’s position relative to the Sun and Earth
Earth’s shadow covering the Moon each week
Changes in the Moon’s distance from Earth
The Moon producing its own light
questions.explanation: Phases are the changing view of the Moon’s sunlit half as it orbits Earth.

questions.prompt: Earth’s seasons are mainly caused by…
choices: Earth being closer to the Sun in summer
questions.explanation: Tilt changes sun angle and day length through the year.

questions.prompt: An exoplanet is…
choices: A planet that orbits a star outside our Solar System
A planet made mostly of ice
A moon that orbits a planet
questions.explanation: Exoplanets orbit stars other than the Sun.

questions.prompt: The event horizon of a black hole is the…
choices: Boundary beyond which light cannot escape
Ring of debris orbiting the black hole
questions.explanation: Crossing the event horizon means escape would require faster-than-light travel.

questions.prompt: Astronomers use spectroscopy mainly to…
choices: Identify the composition and motion of distant objects
Count how many planets are in the Solar System
questions.explanation: Spectral lines reveal elements and Doppler shifts reveal motion.

questions.prompt: Hubble’s law (for nearby galaxies) says that…
choices: All galaxies are moving toward the Milky Way
The universe is shrinking over time
questions.explanation: Recession speed increases roughly with distance due to cosmic expansion.

questions.prompt: A constellation is best described as…
choices: A recognized pattern/region of stars as seen from Earth
A cluster of stars physically close together
questions.explanation: Constellations are sky patterns/regions; the stars are not usually near each other in space.

questions.prompt: Which is a dwarf planet?
questions.explanation: Pluto is classified as a dwarf planet; the others are moons.
